item.content:
Background

The Open Telecom Platform (OTP) is a powerful set of libraries essential to the success of erlang in the building of massively scalable soft real-time systems with requirements on high availability. One of the greatest benefits of using Elixir to develop software is it’s seamless interop with erlang libraries (including those in OTP).

bulletz.io is a browser game built with Elixir and the phoenix framework.

This post will showcase the usage of OTP in bulletz.io as an example of how to design fault tolerant and highly parallel applications.
